moves.2. Bg2 c6 3. Nf3 Qc7 4. O-O Bc5 5. c3 d6: With the queens off the board h3 helps free up white's bishop.
moves.20... Rfe8 21. Nd4: Nd2 might have been better.  Rd8, RxR, NxR, I guess the white pawn is still protected.  Never mind.
moves.21... Nxd4 22. Rxd4 Rad8 23. Rb4: With white up a pawn every trade is to his advantage.
moves.23... b6 24. f3: Pe5 might have been kind of clever too.  Although black could respond h5, PxP does a good job of splitting black's castle pawns.
moves.24... Bc8 25. Rc1 Kg8 26. Rbc4 Be6 27. R: Blunder.  Rd2+ trades white's rook for black's bishop.
